title: How to Clean an Idle Air Control Valve in a Honda Accord

steps.title: Purchase a new IACV gasket.
steps.content: Purchase a new IACV gasket. You will need to replace the old one on your Honda IACV before returning it back to its place under the hood.

steps.title: Locate the IACV.
steps.content: Locate the IACV. You will find it at the back center of the under hood area, near the throttle body (TB) and mounted on the rear of the intake manifold (IM). You will have to remove the TB intake hose in order to gain access to area of the IM that is connected to the IACV.

steps.title: Remove the Honda idle air control valve.
steps.content: Remove the Honda idle air control valve. [1] X Research source Unscrew the 2 bolts attaching the IACV to the intake manifold. You will have to feel around for the lower bolt, which will be just out of plain sight. Pull out the gray plug from the right side of the Honda IACV. Remove the blue plug from the throttle body. Locate the coolant hose that attaches the IACV to the TB. Use needle-nose pliers to pull back the clamp that holds the coolant hose in place and then pull the hose out. This will provide enough slack to pull the Honda idle air control valve to the front so you can completely remove it. Detach the last 2 hoses from the IACV in order to free it for cleaning.

steps.title: Remove the gasket from the Honda IACV and throw it away.
steps.content: Remove the gasket from the Honda IACV and throw it away.

steps.title: Examine the valve so as to identify the carbon build up that must be cleaned out.
steps.content: Examine the valve so as to identify the carbon build up that must be cleaned out. Note the areas with the heaviest concentration of filth, as you will need to pay special attention to them during the cleaning. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Clean the Honda idle air control valve.
steps.content: Clean the Honda idle air control valve. Spray the valve with the carb cleaner, being sure to thoroughly saturate the heavy buildup. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the IACV to dry completely.
steps.content: Allow the IACV to dry completely. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Put the new gasket in its place.
steps.content: Put the new gasket in its place.

steps.title: Reinstall the IACV going backwards through the uninstall process.
steps.content: Reinstall the IACV going backwards through the uninstall process. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Adjust the idle control to its ideal setting.
steps.content: Adjust the idle control to its ideal setting.
